text: The 1987 Montreal Expos season was the 19th season in franchise history. ==Offseason== * October 7, 1986: Bert Roberge was released by the Expos.Bert Roberge at Baseball-Reference * December 9, 1986: John Mizerock was signed as a Free Agent with the Montreal Expos. * January 19, 1987: Dave Engle was signed as a free agent by the Expos.Dave Engle at Baseball-Reference * February 3, 1987: Jeff Reardon and Tom Nieto were traded by the Expos to the Minnesota Twins for Neal Heaton, Yorkis Pérez, Jeff Reed, and Al Cardwood (minors).Jeff Reardon at Baseball-Reference * February 16, 1987: Pascual Pérez was signed as a free agent by the Expos.Pascual Pérez at Baseball-Reference * February 20, 1987: Al Newman was traded by the Montreal Expos to the Minnesota Twins for Mike Shade (minors).https://www.baseball- reference.com/n/newmaal01.shtml ==Spring training== The Expos held spring training at West Palm Beach Municipal Stadium in West Palm Beach, Florida – a facility they shared with the Atlanta Braves. It was their 11th season at the stadium; they had conducted spring training there from 1969 to 1972 and since 1981. ==Regular season== * August 16, 1987: Tim Raines hit for the cycle in a 10-7 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates at Olympic Stadium, going five-for- five in the process.
